DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque1: これは、村近くにある木立の川で見つかった奇妙な古代の金属板である。
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque2: その起源は不明であり、明らかにNomaiのものでもHearthianのものでもない。ある時点で木の炉辺に別の文明が存在していたのだろうか？残念ながら、この金属板がその文明に関してこれまでに発見された唯一の手がかりとなっている。
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque3: 金属板に施された彫刻には我々の星系と、我々に最も近い星系であろう、炉辺の隣人が描かれている。はるばるそこからやってきたのだろうか？
DialogueDictionary.$HNPlaque4: 我々はその答えを長らく知ることはできなかったが、Outer Wilds Venturesの探査艇に先日ワープドライブが搭載されたため、ついにこの謎が解明されるかもしれない！
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod1: [間違いない、これは博物館の金属板の元である！ある時点で船体から剥がれたようだが、明らかに同じ金属と塗装でできている。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod2: [構造から判断するに、これは脱出ポッドの一種である。状態は良好であり、おそらく中の住人(たち)は生存しているようだ。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod3: [いつか、生存者に何が起きたのかを知ることはできるだろうか？はるか昔のことであろうが、そのチャンスはあるはずだ。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod4: [おめでとうございます！ここでHearth's Neighborは終わりです(途中で偶然これを見つけてしまったのでない限り)！この後も作るつもりではあったのですが、時間の都合上、エンディングを短くする必要がありました。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod5: [残念ながら、これがこのMODの当面のエンディングです。もともと計画していたものはもっと複雑なものでしたが、正直にいうと私はほぼ満足してしまいました。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDialoguePod7: [何ですか、もっと何か欲しいですか？いいでしょう。このポッドの信号を知った場所へ戻り、そこで隠されたトンネルを探してください。片側から入ることができ、先は通行止めになっています。しかし、反対側までは続いていて…そこでどのように終わるか見届けることができるでしょう。]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoe1: tis is i shoer, i was quite lazy when modeling blehh
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoe2: [Shoe:Modeller, when he wasn't "busy" playing Terraria, Minecraft, or QSB]
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoeV1: So i guess we really won this, congrats.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoeV2: i was thinking we were going to get 2-3rd place but we acutally were able to get 1st, i'll enjoy my luxurious modder jam with nice fresh bread, also congrats for beating HN and finding us.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevShoeV3: it is lonely in the dark... also xen i will hit you with a hammer!!!
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine1: Hi, I'm Lumine, an artist for the mod! Even if I got a lot of problems, I still managed to do my best, and I hope you will all like our work.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine2: We wanted to have way more illustrations in the mod, but due to the problems I had and the time limit, I couldn't make them.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine3: Even though the story is short, maybe I can continue it in other Mod Jams.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumine4: It was a pleasure to participate to my first mod Jam ever, and I hope you enjoy playing the mod!
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumineV1: Hi, I'm Lumine, one of the creators of the winning mod of the jam, Hearth's Neighbor.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumineV2: I really liked participating in the creation of the mod, even if I wanted to make more and better things for the mod, I couldn't but I'm really happy that I had this incredible experience.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevLumineV3: I also want to thanks GameWyrm, Shoe and EndGameZero, which are incredible people. I'm really happy that we had the opportunity to make this mod even better after the end of the jam, and I hope everyone will like it.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrmTitle: GameWyrm: Team lead and main designer
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm1: Hello! I'm GameWyrm, team lead and level designer. I also did all the garbage models in the mod.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm2: I hope you enjoyed Hearth's Neighbor! It's not the most complex, or polished of the Jam entries, I bet, but it's my desire that you at least had some fun playing it.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm3: We had a much more complex story and ending planned, but due to time constraints, we ended up cutting the more complex stuff.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrm4: My desire for this mod was to create something different from most of the story mods that exist; I explicitly wanted to avoid doing a mod featuring Nomai or Owlks (Sorry, xen, inhabitants]]>). This probably was a bad idea, since it did reduce the pre-made assets we could use and restricted us from using text to communicate to the player, but I hope the mystery surrounding this new race made up for the story's shortcomings.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrmV1: Huh...we won???]]> But how? Well, we're honored to have taken the first place prize!
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrmV2: I personally would have given the award to Tesseract's Secret, but still, very glad to know that people enjoyed our mod!
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevGameWyrmV3: There were so many great Jam entries this time around, and I can't wait for the next one!'
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame1: Hi! I'm EndgameZero, the composer for Hearth's Neighbor.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame2: I had a lot of fun making the music for this mod, and I hope you enjoyed it.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame3: I especially liked writing parts that modified songs from the base game (The River but in 5/4 time was my favorite) and hiding secrets (can you hear any right now?).
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgame4: As this is my first mod jam (and my first mod in general): This song is new to me, but I am honored to be a part of it.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgameV1: Well, I definitely didn't expect to win the jam, so that's pretty cool.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevEndgameV2: Anyway, I hid some more secrets this time ::)
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc1: The ship dock used in the Lake Core was made by Shoe prior to the Jam for another mod.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc2: A few sounds were taken from FreeSounds, by smokinghotdog.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc3: Special thanks to John Corby, Triffid, xen, and Idiot on the Outer Wilds Modding Discord for answering many questions we had about development.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc4: Thanks to the New Horizons mod team as well. Without them, there is no way we could have made this mod within this time frame.
DialogueDictionary.$HNDevMisc5: Russian Translation by Metrocop12. French Translation by Luke Hakurei.

ShipLogDictionary.$HNACDescription: 北の荒野の下に、凍った浮島が連なる奇妙な土地を見つけた。それらを越えるには、ジャンプによる上昇の勢いがあるうちにブーストすることでさらに高度を稼げることを覚えておくなど、多くのジェットパックスキルが要求される。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACRedHouse: 最も大きな島にて、おそらくこの惑星の住民のかつての住居と思われる建物を見つけた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACRedMural: 家の中には、孤独な隠者内部にどうにかして3つのポケット次元を作り出している火の住人が描かれた壁画が存在する。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACCode: テーブルには何らかのコードが書かれている。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACSecretInfo: 高山のコアの非常に遠く離れた島には家が存在する。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNACSecretMap: 家には我々の星系を含む、近くの星系を示す星図がある。住民達は我々の星系近くの奇妙な異常に興味を持っていたようだが、そこまでのルートについて、あるいはそもそも行くべきかどうかについて意見の相違があったようだ。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSAlpineRumor: 高山のコアにて、私はある種のコードを見つけた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSLakeRumor: 湖の神殿にて、水の民が大型宇宙船を建造した証拠を発見した。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSDeadLakeRumor: 死んだ湖の大きな扉の後ろにあるパラボラアンテナで、宇宙からの信号を検知した。何らかの救難信号のようだ。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSLavaRumor: 溶岩の神殿にて、住民が建造した大型船を描いた壁画を発見した。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSEntry: 星系の端に、生存者のいない船が浮かんでいる。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSBarrier: 船の入口はバリアで封じられている。近くに5桁のコードを入力するパネルがある。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSInfo: 船は幽霊物質で満たされている。まだ最小限の動力は残されているものの、エンジンはもう機能していないようだ。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSCryo: コールドスリープ用のポッドで満ちた部屋がある。しかし、その中の住民は皆、ずっと昔に亡くなっている。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSCockpit: コックピットに入る道を見つけた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSDamage: コックピットの画面には、ある種の被害状況が表示されている。火の民が船に侵入し乗っ取ろうとしたが、目覚めていた水の民が反撃した。火の指導者は水の指導者と戦おうとしたが、敗れた。最後の反抗手段として、火の指導者は幽霊物質爆弾を作動させて乗員全員を殺害し、船は動かなくなった。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNDSHope: ある画面には、脱出ポッドの1つが無事に発射されたことが表示されている。それは木の炉辺に着陸した。その後、船はポッドとの通信を開始し、信号周波数を明らかにした。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKDescription: 死んだ湖の下には、いくつかの島が点在する奇妙な海がある。私を降ろしたエレベーターの隣には、北を向いて空中に浮かぶパラボラアンテナが存在する。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKRaft: 始まりの島にはイカダがある。その制御装置は光に反応するようだ。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineRumor: 始まりの島の北、高台に何らかの神殿がある。その神殿への階段は長い時間の経過により崩れ落ちている。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineEntry: 神殿には水中のトンネルを通った秘密の入口が存在する。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNKLKShrineStation: 神殿内には間に合わせの通信装置のようなものがある。そこにはレバーがついており、そして入口の方角を向いたパラボラアンテナが空中に浮いている。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineLever: レバーは死んだ湖にある格納庫の扉を開けた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrineMural: 神殿には火と水の民という2つの勢力間の戦争を描いた壁画がある。この戦いにより惑星の大部分は居住不可能な状態となった。この状況を見た双方の指導者らは休戦に合意し、再建を始めた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKShrinePoster: 通信エリアの上にあるポスターには、水の民が船を宇宙に飛ばし、そしてゆっくりとより大きな船を建造している様子が描かれている。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKMazeInfo: 始まりの島の南には大きな陸地があり、そこにはトンネルがある。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLKMazeGazebo: トンネルを抜けるとその陸地の地表に出た。壁画が描かれた展望台があり、それは神殿の下の水中にトンネルが存在することを示しているようだ。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVDescription: 絶えた火山の下には、溶岩が上下するひび割れた球体がある。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtons: このコアには様々なボタンによってロックされた構造体が存在する。そのボタンを押すのはとても簡単でありアクティブ化するのにほとんど圧力を必要としないが、すべてを同時にアクティブにする必要がある。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVSignal: コア入口にあるアンテナは、コア内の様々な構造物と通信を送受信している。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVFirstButtonInfo: すぐ外にボタンのあるロックされた構造物を見つけた。2つ目が見当たらないが、溶岩に落ちているのだろうか？
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVSecondButtonInfo: 近くに溶岩から突き出た2本の柱がある、ロックされた構造物を見つけた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVThirdButtonInfo: 一連のロックされた構造物群を見つけた。
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineInfo: Near the entrance to the lava core exists a very large building. It is not made of metal like the other structures nearby. A barrier prevents entry.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineInfoAlt: A shrine can be found a short distance from the entrance to the lava core. A barrier blocks entry, but activating three buttons across the core opens it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonOne: I found a button at the Structure on a Cliff.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonTwo: I found a button at the Structure by Pillars.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVButtonThree: I found a button at the Old Abandoned Town.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineEntry: When I entered the shrine, I fell through a fake floor! It turns out that the inhabitants have walls that appear to exist, but are not at all solid. The only way to tell that wall is fake is a symbol on it, which could be <![CDATA[<color=orange>hidden in plain sight</color>]]>.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLVShrineMurals: At the end of the shrine, I found four murals. The first three seem to depict several planets becoming increasingly unstable and falling apart. The fourth depicts a group flying away in a ship, while another group is saddened and angered at being left behind.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHArrival: I've arrived in Hearth's Neighbor. The only immediately obvious feature in this system is a lone, dusty planet.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHInfo: Hearth's Neighbor's sole planet. The surface is devoid of life.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHElevator: I found some kind of elevator that went below the surface and emerged in a strange expansive area. Is this planet <![CDATA[<color=orange>bigger on the inside</color>]]>?
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantRumor: There is a strange domed structure on the surface of Lonely Hermit.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantNoEntry: There does not seem to be a way inside. Judging by the copious amounts of Ghost Matter leaking out of it, it may not be a good idea to go inside it regardless.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHPlantInfo: A mural indicates that this structure is built around a comet that once crashed into the planet. The planet's inhabitants harnessed a power from within the comet to fuel their civilization.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandRumor: There appears to be some snow-covered mountains at the north pole.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandRumorAlt: At the north pole, there are small remnants of civilization.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHWastelandElevator: I found a functioning elevator in the wasteland.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoRumor: There appears to be a tall, hollow mountain close to the south pole.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoRumorAlt: A long-extinct volcano exists on the surface.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHVolcanoElevator: I found a functioning elevator on a structure within the caldera of the volcano.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeRumor: There is a large structure surrounded by a moat.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeRumorAlt: A strange structure exists surrounded by a moat. Despite the water, the area does not have any signs of life.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeElevator: I found a functioning elevator within the structure.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeHangar: The structure has some kind of landing/launching pad for larger ships. The pad is connected to a large hangar of some kind where the inhabitants of this planet stored resources to build a much larger structure.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeDoorRumor: There is a massive locked door in the hangar.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNLHLakeDoorSatellite: Behind the door was a floating satellite pointing at something in space. There is a signal coming out of it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateIntro: The museum has restored an old exhibit that's been in storage for a while. It can be found behind the stairs.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateIntroAlt: The museum has an alien plate on display. While it doesn't seem to be Nomai in origin, its creator is unknown.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateDetails: The plate has a map of two solar systems carved on it. One is our system, but the other is a nearby system, Hearth's Neighbor. With a warp drive in one's ship, one could warp to that system and check it out.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNMuseumPlateResolution: The plate was left by the sole survivor of Hearth's Neighbor's inhabitants. They had crashed onto our planet and lived here until the end of their days.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodRumor: The damage report from the Derelict Ship showed an escape pod land on Timber Hearth. A signal from the ship connected to it.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodResolution: The pod is intact! Whoever landed here survived, though what happened to them is a mystery lost to time. The plate at the museum came from the hull of the pod, likely carved out by the survivor(s) wanting to leave a message of where they came from.
ShipLogDictionary.$HNPodThanks: You have finished the Jam version of Hearth's Neighbor! Congrats! Of course, there may still be a few secrets remaining...

UIDictionary.DERELICT SHIP COCKPIT: 遺棄船のコックピット
